content: mesh based on a multiple of 3 stitches plus 1 − begin a row with ch5 counts as double_crochet ch2 skip 1st 3 stitches the 1st double_crochet and 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet − continue with ch2 skip 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet across the row until one mesh square remains − end with double_crochet into 3rd chain into the chain not the chain space of the ch5 from the previous row instructions make a chain approximately the width of your scarf using a multiple of 3 stitches plus 1 a row of eight mesh squares works for many indoor scarves and gauges this would require a chain of 25 stitches do one row in single_crochet now continue in filet mesh until the scarf is the length you want remembering that you will be creating fringe when you add the ribbon my scarves are 48 including the fringe so the crocheted part is about 42 finish with a row of single_crochet and fasten_off weave in your ends measure the length of your scarf and decide how long you want the fringe on each end cut corresponding lengths of ribbon one or two for each square in the width of your scarf for example suppose your scarf is 42 inches long you want 3 inches of fringe on each end you have eight squares across and you will put two ribbons in each square you should cut 16 ribbons each at least 48 inches long consider adding a couple of inches so that you can even up the fringe at the ends this only uses about 22 yards of ribbon you can see that you can get multiple woven scarves out of a single hank using either your fingers or a crochet hook or a yarn needle weave the ribbon through your squares in a simple over-and-under manner alternating for each ribbon make sure the ribbon is not twisted leave the fringe hanging on each end when you are done weaving trim the ends to approximately the same length if you have picked the correct gauge you should not have to worry about the ribbon sliding out however you can tie some of the pieces of fringe together if you like that look enjoy © proper trappings 2007
